name: Data sharing
description: Sending all the data required to count subjects in one place.

name: Sum of counts
description: Sending the counts from each node to be added together.

name: Data sharing
description: Sending all the data required to calculate the mean of subjects in one place.

name: Basic decomposition
description: Sending the local sums of the value and the counts to an aggregator to calculate the aggregate mean

name: Basic decomposition
description: Using sufficient statistics to compute variance: sum\, sum of squares\, and count

name: Basic pooling
description: Each TRE bins data locally\,  aggregator sums frequencies per bin
notes: Requires agreement on bin boundaries across TREs

name: Basic pooling
description: Each TRE finds local minimum\, aggregator takes minimum of minima

name: Basic pooling
description: Each TRE finds local maximum\, aggregator takes maximum of maxima

name: Basic pooling
description: Each TRE sends counts\,  aggregator calculates proportions

name: Data pooling
description: Pool the row-level data for the fields required to calculate covariances

name: Data pooling
description: Share the row-level data for time-to-event and predictor variables, then fit the Cox proportional hazards model in the aggregator

name: Data pooling
description: Clients send row-level data to the aggregator, which then calculates the quartiles

name: Data pooling
description: Clients send the row-level data for the variables in question, which the aggregator uses to calculate the statistic.

name: Data pooling
description: Clients send row-level data for the response of each group for the aggregator to compare

name: Data pooling
description: Clients send over the row-level data for the response variable for the cohort

name: Basic decomposition
description: Clients send the summary statistics sufficient to calculate the statistic
notes:
For one sample t-test
$$t=\frac{\bar{x} - \mu_0}{s/\sqrt{n}}$$
The sample mean, $\bar{x}$ can be calculated from the sum of the response variable and the count.
The sample standard deviation can be calculated from the sum, sum of squares, and the count.

name: Basic decomposition
description: Clients send sufficient summary statistics for calculating the statistic
notes:
$$\rho_{X,Y}=\frac{cov(X,Y)}{\sigma_X \sigma_Y}$$
$cov$ is the covariance
$\sigma_X$ is the standard deviation of $X$
$\sigma_Y$ is the standard deviation of $Y$
